segment.source: description: Entity Framework (EF) is an object-relational mapper that enables you to work with relational data using domain-specific objects.
segment.target: description: Entity Framework (EF) is an object-relational mapper that enables you to work with relational data using domain-specific objects.

segment.source: title: Entity framework 7 with SQLite for C# apps
segment.target: title: Entity framework 7 with SQLite for C# apps

segment.source: Entity framework 7 with SQLite for C# apps
segment.target: Entity framework 7 with SQLite for C# apps

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Entity Framework (EF) is an object-relational mapper that enables you to work with relational data using domain-specific objects.
segment.target: Entity Framework (EF) is an object-relational mapper that enables you to work with relational data using domain-specific objects.

segment.source: This article explains how you can use Entity Framework 7 with a SQLite database in a Universal Windows app.
segment.target: This article explains how you can use Entity Framework 7 with a SQLite database in a Universal Windows app.

segment.source: Originally for .NET developers, Entity Framework 7 can be used with SQLite on Universal Windows Platform (UWP) to store and manipulate relational data using domain specific objects.
segment.target: Originally for .NET developers, Entity Framework 7 can be used with SQLite on Universal Windows Platform (UWP) to store and manipulate relational data using domain specific objects.

segment.source: You can migrate EF code from a .NET app to a UWP app and expect it work with appropriate changes to the connection string.
segment.target: You can migrate EF code from a .NET app to a UWP app and expect it work with appropriate changes to the connection string.

segment.source: Currently EF only supports SQLite on UWP.
segment.target: Currently EF only supports SQLite on UWP.

segment.source: A detailed walkthrough on installing Entity Framework 7, and creating models is available at the Getting Started on Universal Windows Platform page.
segment.target: A detailed walkthrough on installing Entity Framework 7, and creating models is available at the Getting Started on Universal Windows Platform page.
